abstract:
Outside of my technical writing work for software projects I have been
creating a board game. A board game also requires mechanics to function
and players to clearly understand how these mechanics work to use and
appreciate fully.

As part of my research for writing game manuals I looked at manuals for
furniture, electronics, and cars to see how they explain to users how to
setup and use their products.

In this presentation I will look at how the technical writing skills of
different industries can learn from each other.

This will include:

-  Game Manuals and tutorials
-  Assembly instructions (e.g. those wonderful Ikea inserts)
-  Service Manuals for electronics

And as part of looking at these case studies, the presentation will
cover:

-  Iconography vs Text
-  The limitations of updating print manuals
-  Reducing language and cultural colloquialisms
-  Identifying what needs to be said and what doesn't

And by the end of the presentation I hope that everyone will have learnt
a lot from each other and realize that we're all trying to achieve the
same thing(s).
